channel.title: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]

item.title: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:24, topic:441434”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=544131.msg3988817#msg3988817 date=1336283899]
Love the title. I had bad experiences with SQL when I first started rsps (as always, the idiot was loading every absolute thing from SQL, so if I wanted to add a npc drop I had to create a new table and it was very tedious), so I never really did like it. I guess I would only load player files from SQL unless forced otherwise (can’t think of anything else). Another good thing from loading the player’s data from a SQL database is you can then link it to your website.
[/quote]

SQLite is file based and does not require a database connection. For this reason, it’s good for little developments such as yours. Use it. Because its better than a flat custom file. Web integration is possible but very unlikely you’d be administrating your web server and RSPS server on the same machine given your background.[/quote]
Which is why I said I would use it. :rolleyes:

Read full topic
item.source: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

that has nothing to do with what I was talking about, smartypants… I was talking about other things like mysql for people that do want to use xampp or host on their own server that uses mysql

item.source: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]

item.title: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:25, topic:441434”]Better yet, just use standard SQL query syntax instead of the specific SQLite methods so that you can implement something like normal jdbc as well, while using the same query constants. And have a configuration file with a value on which method to use or whatever.

Also, luld:

don’t want the hassle of having external dependencies?[/quote]derp

http://www.zentus.com/sqlitejdbc/

Read full topic
item.source: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]

item.title: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Better yet, just use standard SQL query syntax instead of the specific SQLite methods so that you can implement something like normal jdbc as well, while using the same query constants. And have a configuration file with a value on which method to use or whatever.

Also, luld:

don't want the hassle of having external dependencies?
derp

Read full topic
item.source: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]

item.title: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

The Wanderer:

Love the title. I had bad experiences with SQL when I first started rsps (as always, the idiot was loading every absolute thing from SQL, so if I wanted to add a npc drop I had to create a new table and it was very tedious), so I never really did like it. I guess I would only load player files from SQL unless forced otherwise (can’t think of anything else). Another good thing from loading the player’s data from a SQL database is you can then link it to your website.

SQLite is file based and does not require a database connection. For this reason, it’s good for little developments such as yours. Use it. Because its better than a flat custom file. Web integration is possible but very unlikely you’d be administrating your web server and RSPS server on the same machine given your background.

Read full topic
item.source: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]

item.title: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:20, topic:441434”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=544131.msg3988761#msg3988761 date=1336278886]

Why are you using SQLite? it doesn’t enforce any datatype safety for the fields. (ie. you could essentially put a paragraph in a field designed for an integer value).

easily solved by having an iq greater than 6 and not doing that

n10si_t, i think you also forgot to mention the inconvenience caused when having to add to what’s in the player data files (programmatically checking for fields in the file and updating, or using a program to bulk modify) and how instead with SQL(ite) you make it easy by just adding a new field to the playerdata table.

do you mean like editing the value of a variable in a file or adding a whole other variable in?

[/quote]

Logically nobody should, but that won’t necessarily stop the uneducated.[/quote]the uneducated wouldn’t get further than the first paragraph of the OP anyway

[quote=“n10si t, post:18, topic:441434”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=544131.msg3988757#msg3988757 date=1336278412]
Why are you using SQLite? it doesn’t enforce any datatype safety for the fields. (ie. you could essentially put a paragraph in a field designed for an integer value).
[/quote]

easily solved by having an iq greater than 6 and not doing that

n10si_t, i think you also forgot to mention the inconvenience caused when having to add to what’s in the player data files (programmatically checking for fields in the file and updating, or using a program to bulk modify) and how instead with SQL(ite) you make it easy by just adding a new field to the playerdata table.

do you mean like editing the value of a variable in a file or adding a whole other variable in?[/quote]
adding a new one in to all the player files

Read full topic

item.title: How to not suck cock with databases [SQLite]
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:11, topic:441434”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=544131.msg3988470#msg3988470 date=1336250952]

holy twirling dicks t4, this won’t be used!

i figured as much, oh well - i tried.

it’d only really be beneficial to large servers anyways - the difference between loading 10-15 characters from the host computer and from a sql database isn’t all that much. it’d be good when your loading 200-250 characters, but only a small amount of servers have that many players and the owners of said servers are 90% morons doing it for money
[/quote]
having thousands of player profiles in your disk is quite disgusting and inefficient… and bad for your file allocation table![/quote]

right. i forget about that. i wrote a program to clean out files older than 1 month, back when i did this stuff.
